title: Salmon with Creamy Dill Sauce from Swanson®

instructions.1: Season the fish with the salt and black pepper.
instructions.2: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook for 3 minutes. Turn the fish over and cook for 1 minute. Remove the fish from the skillet. Wipe the skillet clean with a paper towel.
instructions.3: Heat the remaining oil in the skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallots and garlic and cook and stir for 3 minutes or until tender.
instructions.4: Stir in the wine and cook for 3 minutes or until the wine is almost evaporated. Stir in the stock and heavy cream and heat to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 15 minutes or until the mixture is reduced to about 3/4 cup, stirring often. Stir in the dill.
instructions.5: Return the fish to the skillet. Cover and cook for 5 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

questions.question: In Step 5, is the fish from Step 1 being used?
Is fish from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is heavy cream from Step 4 still available in Step 5?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 4?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to return the fish in Step 5?
Can we stir (Step 4) and return (Step 5) at the same time?
